intro: Bejaria myrtifolia, commonly known as the myrtle-leaved bejaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that resemble those of myrtle, hence its common name. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, adding ornamental value to gardens. Bejaria myrtifolia is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
